column1: Appendix table 2. Counts for Map 1: Rate of RICO defendants convicted per 1,000 total defendants convicted, by state or territory, FY 2018–2022
Report title: Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) Cases in Federal Courts, 2012–2022  NCJ 308952
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Criminal Master File, fiscal years 2018–2022
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, PhD, and Mark Motivans, PhD, BJS Statisticians
Appendix table 2. Counts for Map 1: Rate of RICO defendants convicted per 1,000 total defendants convicted, by state or territory, FY 2018–2022

column3: Number of defendants convicted under RICO
column4: Rates of defendants convicted under RICO per 1,000 total convictions

column1: Note: The rate is computed as the number of persons convicted in U.S. district court with Title 18 U.S.C. §§ 1961–1968 as the most serious offense at conviction divided by the total number of persons convicted in U.S. district court by state and multiplied by 1,000. RICO denotes Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Criminal Master File, fiscal years 2018–2022.
